intro: Scaligeria afghanica, commonly known as Afghan scaleria, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found at high altitudes. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, with a subtle, spicy scent.
